sequence:
Avrora and Her Jovial Friends

<size=45>Chapter 2: Nostalgia</size>

scripts.say: Avrora told me about what happened at the training exercise.
In the end, I didn't really do much. The others were the ones who charged forward and seized victory...
But maybe that's not a very satisfactory explanation? Hmm... how should I explain this then?
Avrora brought two stainless steel cups before me, each filled with a clear liquid.
This story might take a while, so why don't we have a drink first?
This is one of our authentic specialties from the Northern Parliament.
"Authentic specialty?" ...Was she talking about... "that?"
Come to think of it, the label on the bottle she poured the liquid from...
Here you go, Commander.
If it really is "that," then I should...

options.content: Sip it like a hoity-toity bourgeoisie
Slam it down like a true proletariat

scripts.say: ...I knew it, it's alcohol...
With even a small sip, a burning sensation spread through my mouth as if I had consumed fire.
Commander, are you all right...?
I could feel the flames slithering through my body...

Not only were my mouth and throat on fire, it felt as if all the organs that substance had coursed through were also wreathed in fire, a burning halo threatening to burst through my skull as lights danced before my eyes.
.........It took a few minutes for my senses to fully return to me.
Commander, are you still with me...?
To bring the "light of dawn" to our peoples, and to fulfill the history of revolutsiya embodied within the keels of us Northern Parliament ships...
Commander, there's a lot that I have to tell you...
And thus Avrora began here recollection of the Northern Parliament with a soothing voice.
It was a lighthearted tale of her daily misadventures with her quirky friends.
It was a solemn tale of her peoples' struggles against the Sirens.
It was an eye-opening tale of the various peoples whose diverse cultures and lifestyles dyed the white of the North into a dazzling array of colors.
And as one topic flowed into the next, the bottles of vodka flowed freely into my cup.
Someday, I want to take you to the Northern Parliament with me, Commander.
Her words, tinged with nostalgia and longing, seemed as profound as her stomach.
